page.title: 10TOURISM IN DUNURE
page.content: Dunure village shares visitors to County Town of Ayr NTS property Culzean (Castle and Country Park) and Burns' Trail being approx. 7 miles from each.Features are Dunure Castle ruins intact Dovecote,Recreation Park,Picnic Areas,Parking,Harbour, Pleasure Craft,Fishing,Skin Diving. The shore yields agates sandy bays for bathing etc.Ornithologists,Botanists, Photographers,Artists and foreign/home Tourists frequent the area. Tearoom, charity coffee mornings and fetes - Kennedy Hall and Park,Hotel facilities B and B (village and farms) accommodate visitors.Views to Firth of Clyde,Ailsa Craig sunsets behind Isle of Arran and general unspoilt beauty are main attractions. 7 lighthouses can be seen from the village on a clear night.
